metadata.specialization: A1N, Second cycle, has only first-cycle course/s as entry requirements

sections.Confirmation:
This course syllabus was confirmed by The IT Faculty Board on 2009-09-18 to be valid
from 2010-09-01.
sections.Position in the educational system:
5 higher education credits, is a part of the Computer Science Masters programme and
an elective course at University of Gothenburg.
The course is worth 7. This course is labeled as an A1N course.
The course can be part of the following programmes: 1) Computer Science, Master's
Programme (N2COS), 2) Computer Science, Bachelor's Programme (N1COS) and 3)
No translation available (NDATM)
sections.Entry requirements:
To be eligible for the course
students should have successfully completed two years of studies within Computer
Science or equivalent. The course DIT860 Graphical Interfaces or equivalent is
required.
sections.Learning outcomes:
Knowledge and understanding
After completing the course the student is expected to be able to:
• understand the difference between the methods employed in craftsmanship,
traditional design, and modern design
• develop and describe new design methods
• reflect on your own design process objectively
Skills and abilities
After completing the course the student is expected to be able to:
• criticize design processes with respect to methods used
• modify design methods to fit the context they are to be used in
Judgement and approach
After completing the course the student is expected to be able to:
• plan design projects with respect to design goals, stakeholders' requirements, and
available resources and expertise
• design with regards to aesthetical issues of interaction
sections.Course content:
The course introduces basic design methodology in interaction design with focus on
design issues related to aesthetics. Theory is combined with practical training to give
students training in working systematically with the design of computational things and
systems. Training in specific design methods are provided through exercises and the
group project while meta methods such as iterative design are aspects of the group
project.
sections.Form of teaching:
Language of instruction: English
The course is given in English.
sections.Assessment:
The student is examined by project work in a group and as a individually written home
exam. In cases where a course has been discontinued or major changes have been made
a student should be guaranteed at least three examination occasions (including the
ordinary examination occasion) during a time of at least one year from the last time the
course was given. A student who has failed a test twice has the right to change
examiners, if it is possible. A written application should be sent to the Department.
sections.Grades: The grading scale comprises: Fail, Pass, Pass with distinction.
sections.Course evaluation:
The course is evaluated through meetings both during and after the course between
teachers and student representatives. Further, an anonymous questionnaire can be used
to ensure written information. The outcome of the evaluations serves to improve the
course by indicating which parts could be added, improved, changed or removed.
